snippet: In considering whether some strip clubs should be exempt from sales taxes, the New York Court of Appeals is tackling an unusual subject: whether lap dancing constitutes an art form.
abstract: Nite Moves strip club in Latham, NY, asks the New York State Court of Appeals to rule that it is exempt from paying $124,921.94 in sales tax on its door admission fees; argues that its nude and lap dances are artistic, choreographed performances that should fall under the same provision that exempts Broadway shows and ballet performances from paying taxes on entrance fees.
lead_paragraph: In considering whether some strip clubs should be exempt from sales taxes, the New York Court of Appeals is tackling an unusual subject: whether lap dancing constitutes an art form.

headline.seo: In New York’s Top Court, a Debate Over Lap Dances and Admission Taxes
headline.main: In a Tax Case, a Debate: Is Lap Dancing an Art?
headline.print_headline: In a Tax Case, a Debate: Is Lap Dancing an Art?
